body.name: THE SARACEN STORM: A Novel of the Moorish Invasion of Spain

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An entertaining story of the first Spanish leader to successfully fight the Moors!
reviews.reviewText: The story of Pelayo, a hero in Spanish history, was retold in an amusing and exciting way. The description of the many battles he fought and the intricacies of his personal life gave a strong flavor to the story. Very enjoyable reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good historical fiction couched firmly in accurate history.
reviews.reviewText: I read a lot of historical fiction with some of the greats like Noah Gordon, Ken Follett, CS Forester and Bernard Cornwell. The author stands well amongst those names and I recommend this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun way to learn Iberian history
reviews.reviewText: Lástima que para aprender más de la historia de España en los años de los Moros tenga que leer un libro en inglés pero fue fabuloso el libro.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Storm Comes to Spain
reviews.reviewText: This novel by J.M. Nunes brilliantly presents the story of the Saracen invasion and occupation of Spain. During this time, Spain was introduced to a whole new world of culture and science. While Europe was in a "Dark Age", the Saracens promoted literacy, geometry, and architecture in Spain. Their skill is evident in the Alhambra, which is definitely worth a visit. The author beautifully recounts the story of the Spanish people in Saracen Storm. From the very first page until the end, the book draws us in. We can only hope that Nunes will write more novels in the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A terrific read. I enjoyed it very much. Good character development and a nice romance also. Historically accurate, who cares.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was a great book! I lived in Spain and learned all about the Moors, but this book really brought it to life! Great characters, adventure and storyline. 100% recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Interesting until it turned into a romance
reviews.reviewText: I confess that I didn't finish this book. The battle and fight scenes reminded me of a 1960's movie where the actors didn't really know what they were doing. It was tolerable until the part where the romance began and then I just couldn't go on. It's obvious the rest of the book is going to involve a lot of mooning about Valentina.I'm a big fan of historical fiction, but I think Christian Cameron has made me notice and imagine fights step by step. Reading this book is kind of like reading Dewey Lambdin after finishing the Aubrey Maturin series. Or ordering Domino's the day after you get back from Italy. Best to think it through first.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great story based on an interesting historical time
reviews.reviewText: I knew little of the Moors invading Spain and this book was an entertaining way to learn a little history.

I really enjoyed this book! It was very interesting. The history of an area I had not read before. The story is very well told with romance, mystery, betrayal, everything you need to make a book you don’t want to put down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A fast paced thrilling read with believable characters, shedding light on a fascinating subject I knew little about, in areas I have travelled. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewTitle: An excellent novel by JM Nunez about the invasion of Spain by the Moors
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed the character build up, history, history about the battles & the battle scenes were terrific.Well worth a read.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great glimpse of the Moors in Iberia.
reviews.reviewText: Great glimpse of the Moors in Iberia.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: An enjoyable read focused on the life of Spanish hero, Pelayo, who I had never heard of and of whom not a great deal, it would seem, is known. He is credited with leading resistance to the invasion by the Moors and keeping northern Spain out of their grasp. It’s a good ’swashbuckling’ kind of tale, albeit I could guess at the start of most chapters what was going to happen next. My main gripe is that it presents the invaders as uncultured barbarians, even though they would establish a society way in advance of anything else in Europe and would show religious tolerance, something which the Spaniards did not when they reconquered Spain centuries later. Still, this isn't a history book but entertainment and at that it certainly succeeds.
